title.en: Monthly Chronicle of the Qin-Chu Interregnum

sentences.zh: 太史公讀秦楚之際，曰：初作難，發於陳涉；

translations.literal: Grand Historian read Qin Chu between, said: Initially made difficulty, arose from Chen She;
translations.idiomatic: Grand Historian read Qin Chu between, said: Initially made difficulty, arose from Chen She; (translated).

translations.literal: Tyrannical cruel extinguished Qin, from Xiang clan;
translations.idiomatic: Tyrannical cruel extinguished Qin, from Xiang clan; (translated).

sentences.zh: 撥亂誅暴，平定海內，卒踐帝祚，成於漢家。

translations.literal: Eliminated chaos executed tyrants, pacified within seas, finally stepped imperial throne, accomplished at Han house.
translations.idiomatic: Eliminated chaos executed tyrants, pacified within seas, finally stepped imperial throne, accomplished at Han house. (translated).

translations.literal: Five years between, commands three changed.
translations.idiomatic: Five years between, commands three changed. (translated).

sentences.zh: 自生民以來，未始有受命若斯之亟

translations.literal: From living people since, never had received mandate like this urgent
translations.idiomatic: From living people since, never had received mandate like this urgent (translated).

translations.literal: The Grand Historian read of the Qin-Chu interregnum and said: The initial uprising began with Chen She; Tyranny and cruelty extinguished Qin, from the Xiang clan; Eliminated chaos and executed tyrants, pacified the realm, finally ascended the imperial throne, accomplished by the Han house. Within five years, the commands changed three times. Since the beginning of civilization, never has there been a mandate received so urgently

sentences.zh: 昔虞、夏之興，積善累功數十年，德洽百姓，攝行政事，考之于天，然後在位。

translations.literal: Former Yu, Xia rise, accumulated virtue piled merit several decades, virtue permeated hundred clans, acted administered government affairs, examined by heaven, then in position.
translations.idiomatic: Former Yu, Xia rise, accumulated virtue piled merit several decades, virtue permeated hundred clans, acted administered government affairs, examined by heaven, then in position. (translated).

sentences.zh: 湯、武之王，乃由契、后稷修仁行義十餘世，不期而會孟津八百諸侯，猶以為未可，其后乃放弒。

translations.literal: Tang, Wu kingship, then from Jie, Hou Ji cultivated benevolence practiced righteousness ten more generations, unexpectedly met Mengjin eight hundred feudal lords, still considered not acceptable, their after then banished assassinated.
translations.idiomatic: Tang, Wu kingship, then from Jie, Hou Ji cultivated benevolence practiced righteousness ten more generations, unexpectedly met Mengjin eight hundred feudal lords, still considered not acceptable, their after then banished assassinated. (translated).

sentences.zh: 秦起襄公，章於文、繆，獻、孝之後，稍以蠶食六國，百有餘載，至始皇乃能并冠帶之倫。

translations.literal: Qin arose Xiang duke, eminent at Wen, Mu, Xian, Xiao after, gradually silkworm eating six states, hundred more years, to First Emperor then able unite capped belted peers.
translations.idiomatic: Qin arose Xiang duke, eminent at Wen, Mu, Xian, Xiao after, gradually silkworm eating six states, hundred more years, to First Emperor then able unite capped belted peers. (translated).

sentences.zh: 以德若彼，用力如此，蓋一統若斯之難也。

translations.literal: Used virtue like that, used force like this, indeed unification like this difficult also.
translations.idiomatic: Used virtue like that, used force like this, indeed unification like this difficult also. (translated).

translations.literal: In former times, when Yu and Xia rose, they accumulated virtue and piled up merit for several decades, their virtue permeated the people, they acted and administered government affairs, were examined by heaven, and only then took position. Tang and Wu's kingship came from Jie and Hou Ji cultivating benevolence and practicing righteousness for over ten generations. Unexpectedly they met at Mengjin with eight hundred feudal lords, but still considered it unacceptable. Only afterward did they banish and assassinate. Qin arose with Duke Xiang, eminent during Wen and Mu, after Xian and Xiao, gradually nibbling away at the six states for over a hundred years, until the First Emperor was able to unite the capped and belted peers. Using virtue like that, using force like this - indeed unification is as difficult as this.

sentences.zh: 秦既稱帝，患兵革不休，以有諸侯也，於是無尺土之封，墮壞名城，銷鋒鏑，鉏豪桀，維萬世之安。

translations.literal: Qin already called emperor, worried weapons armor not cease, because had feudal lords also, thereupon no inch soil enfeoffment, destroyed famous cities, melted weapons arrows, hoed heroes bullies, maintained ten thousand generations peace.
translations.idiomatic: Qin already called emperor, worried weapons armor not cease, because had feudal lords also, thereupon no inch soil enfeoffment, destroyed famous cities, melted weapons arrows, hoed heroes bullies, maintained ten thousand generations peace. (translated).

sentences.zh: 然王跡之興，起於閭巷，合從討伐，軼於三代，鄉秦之禁，適足以資賢者為驅除難耳。

translations.literal: Yet the rise of kingly traces originates from alleyways, uniting horizontally to attack and punish, surpassing the three dynasties, the prohibitions of the Qin facing the people, are just enough to provide material for the worthy ones to drive away difficulties.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the rise of kingly traces originates from alleyways, uniting horizontally to attack and punish, surpassing the three dynasties, the prohibitions of the Qin facing the people, are just enough to provide material for the worthy ones to drive away difficulties. (translated).

sentences.zh: 故憤發其所為天下雄，安在無土不王。

translations.literal: Therefore, venting his anger he did what made him a hero of the world, where is there land that cannot be ruled by a king?
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, venting his anger he did what made him a hero of the world, where is there land that cannot be ruled by a king? (translated).

translations.literal: This is what the commentaries call a great sage?
translations.idiomatic: This is what the commentaries call a great sage? (translated).

translations.literal: How is it not Heaven? How is it not Heaven!
translations.idiomatic: How is it not Heaven? How is it not Heaven! (translated).

sentences.zh: 非大聖孰能當此受命而帝者乎？

translations.literal: If not a great sage, who can bear this receiving the mandate to become emperor?
translations.idiomatic: If not a great sage, who can bear this receiving the mandate to become emperor? (translated).

translations.literal: Qin having become emperor, worried that weapons and armor would never cease because of the feudal lords. Thereupon there were no inch of soil enfeoffments, famous cities were destroyed, weapons and arrows melted, heroes and bullies hoed out, to maintain peace for ten thousand generations. Yet the rise of kingship began in humble alleys; alliances formed to attack and overthrow, surpassing even the Three Dynasties; the Qin prohibitions on the people merely provided the worthy with the means to clear away obstacles. Therefore, venting his rage, he did what made him the hero of the realm. Where is there land that cannot be ruled as king? Is this what the commentaries mean by a great sage? Is it not Heaven? Is it not Heaven! If not a great sage, who could bear receiving the mandate to become emperor?

cells.literal: Chu Hidden King Chen Sheng raised troops entered Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Chu Hidden King Chen Sheng raised troops entered Qin. (translated).

cells.content: 二。葛嬰為涉徇九江，立襄彊為楚王。
cells.literal: Two. Ge Ying for She toured Jiujiang, established Xiang Qiang as Chu king.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Ge Ying for She toured Jiujiang, established Xiang Qiang as Chu king. (translated).

cells.content: 武臣始至邯鄲，自立為趙王，始。
cells.literal: Wu Chen first arrived Handan, self-established as Zhao king, beginning.
cells.idiomatic: Wu Chen first arrived Handan, self-established as Zhao king, beginning. (translated).

cells.literal: Ninth month. Chu troops arrived Xi.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth month. Chu troops arrived Xi. (translated).

cells.content: 三。周文兵至戲，敗。而葛嬰聞涉王，即殺彊。
cells.literal: Three. Zhou Wen troops arrived Xi, defeated. Yet Ge Ying heard She king, immediately killed Qiang.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Zhou Wen troops arrived Xi, defeated. Yet Ge Ying heard She king, immediately killed Qiang. (translated).

cells.literal: Xiang Liang styled Martial Faith Lord.
cells.idiomatic: Xiang Liang styled Martial Faith Lord. (translated).

cells.content: 齊王田儋始。儋，狄人。諸田宗彊。從弟榮，榮弟橫。
cells.literal: Qi king Tian Dan beginning. Dan, Di person. Various Tian clan strong. Younger brother Rong, Rong younger brother Heng.
cells.idiomatic: Qi king Tian Dan beginning. Dan, Di person. Various Tian clan strong. Younger brother Rong, Rong younger brother Heng. (translated).

cells.content: 韓廣為趙略地至薊，自立為燕王始。
cells.literal: Han Guang for Zhao seized territory to Ji, self-established as Yan king beginning.
cells.idiomatic: Han Guang for Zhao seized territory to Ji, self-established as Yan king beginning. (translated).

cells.content: 魏王咎始。咎在陳，不得歸國。
cells.literal: Wei king Jiu beginning. Jiu at Chen, unable return state.
cells.idiomatic: Wei king Jiu beginning. Jiu at Chen, unable return state. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Dan what rose, killed Di magistrate self king.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Dan what rose, killed Di magistrate self king. (translated).

cells.content: 二。擊胡陵、方與，破秦監軍。
cells.literal: Two. Attacked Hu Ling, Fang Yu, broke Qin supervising army.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Attacked Hu Ling, Fang Yu, broke Qin supervising army. (translated).

cells.content: 四。李良殺武臣，張耳、陳餘走。
cells.literal: Four. Li Liang killed Wu Chen, Zhang Er, Chen Yu fled.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Li Liang killed Wu Chen, Zhang Er, Chen Yu fled. (translated).

cells.content: 三。殺泗水守。拔薛西。周市東略地豐沛閒。
cells.literal: Three. Killed Si Shui guard. Pulled Xue west. Zhou Shi east seized territory Feng Pei between.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Killed Si Shui guard. Pulled Xue west. Zhou Shi east seized territory Feng Pei between. (translated).

cells.content: 三。齊、趙共立周市，市不肯，曰「必立魏咎」云。
cells.literal: Three. Qi, Zhao together established Zhou Shi, Shi not willing, said 'must establish Wei Jiu' thus.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Qi, Zhao together established Zhou Shi, Shi not willing, said 'must establish Wei Jiu' thus. (translated).

cells.content: 四。雍齒叛沛公，以豐降魏。沛公還攻豐，不能下。
cells.literal: Four. Yong Chi rebelled Pei duke, with Feng surrendered Wei. Pei duke returned attacked Feng, could not take.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Yong Chi rebelled Pei duke, with Feng surrendered Wei. Pei duke returned attacked Feng, could not take. (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Jiu from Chen returned, established.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Jiu from Chen returned, established. (translated).

cells.literal: Chu king Jing Ju beginning, Qin Jia established him.
cells.idiomatic: Chu king Jing Ju beginning, Qin Jia established him. (translated).

cells.content: 五。涉將召平矯拜項梁為楚柱國，急西擊秦。
cells.literal: Five. She general Zhao Ping falsely appointed Xiang Liang as Chu pillar state, urgently west attacked Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Five. She general Zhao Ping falsely appointed Xiang Liang as Chu pillar state, urgently west attacked Qin. (translated).

cells.content: 趙王歇始，張耳、陳餘立之。
cells.literal: Zhao king Xie beginning, Zhang Er, Chen Yu established him.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao king Xie beginning, Zhang Er, Chen Yu established him. (translated).

cells.content: 五。讓景駒以擅自王不請我。
cells.literal: Five. Reprimanded Jing Ju for arbitrarily becoming king without consulting me.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Reprimanded Jing Ju for arbitrarily becoming king without consulting me. (translated).

cells.content: 五。沛公聞景駒王在留，往從，與擊秦軍碭西。
cells.literal: Five. Pei duke heard Jing Ju king at Liu, went followed, together attacked Qin army Dang west.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Pei duke heard Jing Ju king at Liu, went followed, together attacked Qin army Dang west. (translated).

cells.content: 五。章邯已破涉，圍咎臨濟。
cells.literal: Five. Zhang Han already defeated She, surrounded Jiu at Linji.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Zhang Han already defeated She, surrounded Jiu at Linji. (translated).

cells.content: 六。梁渡江，陳嬰、黥布皆屬。
cells.literal: Six. Liang crossed Jiang, Chen Ying, Qing Bu all attached.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Liang crossed Jiang, Chen Ying, Qing Bu all attached. (translated).

cells.content: 六。景駒使公孫慶讓齊，誅慶。
cells.literal: Six. Jing Ju sent Gongsun Qing to reprimand Qi, executed Qing.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Jing Ju sent Gongsun Qing to reprimand Qi, executed Qing. (translated).

cells.content: 六。攻下碭，收得兵六千，與故凡九千人。
cells.literal: Six. Attacked and took Dang, gathered six thousand troops, with former altogether nine thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Attacked and took Dang, gathered six thousand troops, with former altogether nine thousand. (translated).

cells.content: 七。攻拔下邑，遂擊豐，豐不拔。聞項梁兵眾，往請擊豐。
cells.literal: Seven. Attacked and pulled Xiayi, then attacked Feng, Feng not taken. Heard Xiang Liang troops numerous, went requested attack Feng.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Attacked and pulled Xiayi, then attacked Feng, Feng not taken. Heard Xiang Liang troops numerous, went requested attack Feng. (translated).

cells.content: 八。梁擊殺景駒、秦嘉，遂入薛，兵十餘萬眾。
cells.literal: Eight. Liang attacked and killed Jing Ju, Qin Jia, then entered Xue, troops ten more myriad multitude.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Liang attacked and killed Jing Ju, Qin Jia, then entered Xue, troops ten more myriad multitude. (translated).

cells.content: 八。沛公如薛見項梁，梁益沛公卒五千，擊豐，拔之。雍齒奔魏。
cells.literal: Eight. Pei duke went to Xue to see Xiang Liang, Liang increased Pei duke troops five thousand, attacked Feng, took it. Yong Chi fled to Wei.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Pei duke went to Xue to see Xiang Liang, Liang increased Pei duke troops five thousand, attacked Feng, took it. Yong Chi fled to Wei. (translated).

cells.content: 八。臨濟急，周市如齊、楚請救。
cells.literal: Eight. Linji urgent, Zhou Shi went to Qi, Chu requested rescue.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Linji urgent, Zhou Shi went to Qi, Chu requested rescue. (translated).

cells.content: 楚懷王始，都盱台，故懷王孫，梁立之。
cells.literal: Chu Huai king beginning, capital Xutai, former Huai king grandson, Liang established him.
cells.idiomatic: Chu Huai king beginning, capital Xutai, former Huai king grandson, Liang established him. (translated).

cells.content: 十。梁求楚懷王孫，得之民閒，立為楚王。
cells.literal: Ten. Liang sought Chu Huai king grandson, got him among the people, established as Chu king.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Liang sought Chu Huai king grandson, got him among the people, established as Chu king. (translated).

cells.content: 十。儋救臨濟，章邯殺田儋。榮走東阿。
cells.literal: Ten. Dan rescued Linji, Zhang Han killed Tian Dan. Rong fled Dong'e.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Dan rescued Linji, Zhang Han killed Tian Dan. Rong fled Dong'e. (translated).

cells.content: 十。沛公如薛，共立楚懷王。
cells.literal: Ten. Pei duke went to Xue, together established Chu Huai king.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Pei duke went to Xue, together established Chu Huai king. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Jiu committed suicide, Linji surrendered to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Jiu committed suicide, Linji surrendered to Qin. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Chen Ying became pillar state.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Chen Ying became pillar state. (translated).

cells.content: 十一。天大雨，三月不見星。
cells.literal: Eleven. Heaven great rain, three months not see stars.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Heaven great rain, three months not see stars. (translated).

cells.content: 齊立田假為王，秦急圍東阿。
cells.literal: Qi established Tian Jia as king, Qin urgently surrounded Dong'e.
cells.idiomatic: Qi established Tian Jia as king, Qin urgently surrounded Dong'e. (translated).

cells.content: 十一。沛公與項羽北救東阿，破秦軍濮陽，東屠城陽。
cells.literal: Eleven. Pei duke with Xiang Yu north rescued Dong'e, broke Qin army Puyang, east slaughtered Chengyang.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Pei duke with Xiang Yu north rescued Dong'e, broke Qin army Puyang, east slaughtered Chengyang. (translated).

cells.literal: Jiu younger brother Bao fled Dong'e.
cells.idiomatic: Jiu younger brother Bao fled Dong'e. (translated).

cells.content: 十二。救東阿，破秦軍，乘勝至定陶，項梁有驕色。
cells.literal: Twelve. Rescued Dong'e, broke Qin army, rode victory to Dingtao, Xiang Liang had arrogant color.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Rescued Dong'e, broke Qin army, rode victory to Dingtao, Xiang Liang had arrogant color. (translated).

cells.content: 楚救榮，得解歸，逐田假，立儋子市為齊王，始。
cells.literal: Chu rescued Rong, got to return home, expelled Tian Jia, established Dan son Shi as Qi king, beginning.
cells.idiomatic: Chu rescued Rong, got to return home, expelled Tian Jia, established Dan son Shi as Qi king, beginning. (translated).

cells.content: 十二。沛公與項羽西略地，斬三川守李由於雍丘。
cells.literal: Twelve. Pei duke with Xiang Yu west seized territory, beheaded Sanchuan guard Li You at Yongqiu.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Pei duke with Xiang Yu west seized territory, beheaded Sanchuan guard Li You at Yongqiu. (translated).

cells.content: 十三。章邯破殺項梁於定陶，項羽恐，還軍彭城。
cells.literal: Thirteen. Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang at Dingtao, Xiang Yu feared, returned army Pengcheng.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang at Dingtao, Xiang Yu feared, returned army Pengcheng. (translated).

cells.content: 二。田假走楚，楚趨齊救趙。田榮以假故，不肯，謂「楚殺假乃出兵。」項羽怒田榮。
cells.literal: Two. Tian Jia fled Chu, Chu hastened Qi to save Zhao. Tian Rong because of Jia reason, not willing, said 'Chu kill Jia then send troops.' Xiang Yu angry at Tian Rong.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Tian Jia fled Chu, Chu hastened Qi to save Zhao. Tian Rong because of Jia reason, not willing, said 'Chu kill Jia then send troops.' Xiang Yu angry at Tian Rong. (translated).

cells.content: 十三。沛公聞項梁死，還軍，從懷王，軍於碭。
cells.literal: Thirteen. Pei duke heard Xiang Liang died, returned army, followed Huai king, camped at Dang.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Pei duke heard Xiang Liang died, returned army, followed Huai king, camped at Dang. (translated).

cells.content: 魏豹自立為魏王，都平陽，始。
cells.literal: Wei Bao self-established as Wei king, capital Pingyang, beginning.
cells.idiomatic: Wei Bao self-established as Wei king, capital Pingyang, beginning. (translated).

cells.literal: Five. Appointed Song Yi as supreme general.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Appointed Song Yi as supreme general. (translated).

cells.content: 懷王封項羽於魯，為次將，屬宋義，北救趙。
cells.literal: Huai king enfeoffed Xiang Yu at Lu, made deputy general, belonged to Song Yi, north rescued Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: Huai king enfeoffed Xiang Yu at Lu, made deputy general, belonged to Song Yi, north rescued Zhao. (translated).

cells.content: 十。秦軍圍歇鉅鹿，陳餘出收兵。
cells.literal: Ten. Qin army surrounded Xie Julu, Chen Yu went out gathered troops.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Qin army surrounded Xie Julu, Chen Yu went out gathered troops. (translated).

cells.content: 十四。懷王封沛公為武安侯，將碭郡兵西，約先至咸陽王之。
cells.literal: Fourteen. Huai king enfeoffed Pei duke as Wuan marquis, led Dang commandery troops west, agreed first arrive Xianyang king it.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. Huai king enfeoffed Pei duke as Wuan marquis, led Dang commandery troops west, agreed first arrive Xianyang king it. (translated).

cells.content: 十一。章邯破邯鄲，徙其民於河內。
cells.literal: Eleven. Zhang Han broke Handan, moved its people to Henei.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Zhang Han broke Handan, moved its people to Henei. (translated).

cells.content: 四。齊將田都叛榮，往助項羽救趙。
cells.literal: Four. Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Rong, went to assist Xiang Yu rescue Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Rong, went to assist Xiang Yu rescue Zhao. (translated).

cells.content: 十五。攻破東郡尉及王離軍於成武南。
cells.literal: Fifteen. Attacked and broke Dongjun wei and Wang Li army at Chengwu south.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. Attacked and broke Dongjun wei and Wang Li army at Chengwu south. (translated).

cells.literal: Fifteen. Sent general Zang Tu rescue Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. Sent general Zang Tu rescue Zhao. (translated).

cells.content: 三。羽矯殺宋義，將其兵渡河救鉅鹿。
cells.literal: Three. Yu falsely killed Song Yi, led his troops crossed river rescued Julu.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Yu falsely killed Song Yi, led his troops crossed river rescued Julu. (translated).

cells.content: 四。大破秦軍鉅鹿下，諸侯將皆屬項羽。
cells.literal: Four. Greatly broke Qin army below Julu, feudal lords generals all belonged to Xiang Yu.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Greatly broke Qin army below Julu, feudal lords generals all belonged to Xiang Yu. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirteen. Chu rescue arrived, Qin siege lifted.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Chu rescue arrived, Qin siege lifted. (translated).

cells.content: 六。故齊王建孫田安下濟北，從項羽救趙。
cells.literal: Six. Former Qi king Jian grandson Tian An took Jibei, followed Xiang Yu rescued Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Former Qi king Jian grandson Tian An took Jibei, followed Xiang Yu rescued Zhao. (translated).

cells.content: 十七。（救趙）至栗，得皇訢、武蒲軍。與秦軍戰，破之。
cells.literal: Seventeen. (Rescue Zhao) arrived Li, got Huang Xin, Wu Pu army. Battled with Qin army, broke it.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. (Rescue Zhao) arrived Li, got Huang Xin, Wu Pu army. Battled with Qin army, broke it. (translated).

cells.literal: Five. Captured Qin general Wang Li.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Captured Qin general Wang Li. (translated).

cells.content: 十四。張耳怒陳餘，棄將印去。
cells.literal: Fourteen. Zhang Er angry at Chen Yu, abandoned general seal left.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. Zhang Er angry at Chen Yu, abandoned general seal left. (translated).

cells.literal: Six. Attacked and broke Zhang Han, Zhang Han army retreated.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Attacked and broke Zhang Han, Zhang Han army retreated. (translated).

cells.content: 十九。得彭越軍昌邑，襲陳留。用酈食其策，軍得積粟。
cells.literal: Nineteen. Got Peng Yue army Changyi, raided Chenliu. Used Li Yiji strategy, army got stored grain.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. Got Peng Yue army Changyi, raided Chenliu. Used Li Yiji strategy, army got stored grain. (translated).

cells.content: 二十。攻開封，破秦將楊熊，熊走滎陽，秦斬熊以徇。
cells.literal: Twenty. Attacked Kaifeng, broke Qin general Yang Xiong, Xiong fled Xiangyang, Qin beheaded Xiong to display.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. Attacked Kaifeng, broke Qin general Yang Xiong, Xiong fled Xiangyang, Qin beheaded Xiong to display. (translated).

cells.content: 八。楚急攻章邯，章邯恐，使長史欣歸秦請兵，趙高讓之。
cells.literal: Eight. Chu urgently attacked Zhang Han, Zhang Han feared, sent chief clerk Xin return Qin request troops, Zhao Gao refused him.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Chu urgently attacked Zhang Han, Zhang Han feared, sent chief clerk Xin return Qin request troops, Zhao Gao refused him. (translated).

cells.content: 二十一。攻潁陽，略韓地，北絕河津。
cells.literal: Twenty-one. Attacked Yingyang, raided Han lands, north cut off river crossings.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-one. Attacked Yingyang, raided Han lands, north cut off river crossings. (translated).

cells.content: 九。趙高欲誅欣，欣恐，亡走，告章邯謀叛秦。
cells.literal: Nine. Zhao Gao desired execute Xin, Xin feared, fled ran away, told Zhang Han plotting rebel Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Zhao Gao desired execute Xin, Xin feared, fled ran away, told Zhang Han plotting rebel Qin. (translated).

cells.content: 十。章邯與楚約降，未定，項羽許而擊之。
cells.literal: Ten. Zhang Han with Chu agreed surrender, not yet decided, Xiang Yu agreed then attacked him.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Zhang Han with Chu agreed surrender, not yet decided, Xiang Yu agreed then attacked him. (translated).

cells.content: 二十三。攻南陽守齮，破之陽城郭東。
cells.literal: Twenty-three. Attacked Nanyang defender Yi, broke him east of Yangcheng walls.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. Attacked Nanyang defender Yi, broke him east of Yangcheng walls. (translated).

cells.content: 十一。項羽與章邯期殷虛，章邯等已降，與盟，以邯為雍王。
cells.literal: Eleven. Xiang Yu with Zhang Han agreed Yin Xu, Zhang Han etc already surrendered, made alliance with him, made Han Yong king.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Xiang Yu with Zhang Han agreed Yin Xu, Zhang Han etc already surrendered, made alliance with him, made Han Yong king. (translated).

cells.content: 二十四。降下南陽，封其守齮。
cells.literal: Twenty-four. Surrender took Nanyang, sealed its defender Yi.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Surrender took Nanyang, sealed its defender Yi. (translated).

cells.literal: Fifteen. Shen Yang took Henan, surrendered to Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. Shen Yang took Henan, surrendered to Chu. (translated).

cells.literal: Eighth month. Zhao Gao killed Second Emperor.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth month. Zhao Gao killed Second Emperor. (translated).

cells.content: 十二。以秦降都尉翳、長史欣為上將，將秦降軍。
cells.literal: Twelve. Made Qin surrender major Yi, chief clerk Xin supreme generals, led Qin surrender army.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Made Qin surrender major Yi, chief clerk Xin supreme generals, led Qin surrender army. (translated).

cells.content: 二十一。趙王歇留國。陳餘亡居南皮。
cells.literal: Twenty-one. Zhao king Xie stayed in state. Chen Yu fled resided Nanpi.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-one. Zhao king Xie stayed in state. Chen Yu fled resided Nanpi. (translated).

cells.content: 二十六。攻下嶢及藍田。以留侯策，不戰皆降。
cells.literal: Twenty-six. Attacked took Yao and Lantian. With Liu Hou strategy, without battle all surrendered.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. Attacked took Yao and Lantian. With Liu Hou strategy, without battle all surrendered. (translated).

cells.content: 十四。項羽將諸侯兵四十餘萬，行略地，西至於河南。
cells.literal: Fourteen. Xiang Yu led feudal lords troops forty more ten thousand, went raided lands, west reached Henan.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. Xiang Yu led feudal lords troops forty more ten thousand, went raided lands, west reached Henan. (translated).

cells.content: 二十三。張耳從楚西入秦。
cells.literal: Twenty-three. Zhang Er followed Chu west entered Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. Zhang Er followed Chu west entered Qin. (translated).

cells.content: 二十七。漢元年，秦王子嬰降。沛公入破咸陽，平秦，還軍霸上，待諸侯約。
cells.literal: Twenty-seven. Han first year, Qin prince Ziying surrendered. Pei Gong entered broke Xianyang, pacified Qin, returned army Baxiang, awaited feudal lords agreement.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-seven. Han first year, Qin prince Ziying surrendered. Pei Gong entered broke Xianyang, pacified Qin, returned army Baxiang, awaited feudal lords agreement. (translated).

cells.content: 十五。從項羽略地，遂入關
cells.literal: Fifteen. Followed Xiang Yu raided lands, then entered Guan.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. Followed Xiang Yu raided lands, then entered Guan. (translated).

cells.content: 十五。羽詐阬殺秦降卒二十萬人於新安。
cells.literal: Fifteen. Yu fraudulently pit killed Qin surrender soldiers two hundred thousand people at Xin'an.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. Yu fraudulently pit killed Qin surrender soldiers two hundred thousand people at Xin'an. (translated).

cells.content: 二十八。沛公出令三章，秦民大悅。
cells.literal: Twenty-eight. Pei Gong issued three chapter proclamation, Qin people greatly pleased.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eight. Pei Gong issued three chapter proclamation, Qin people greatly pleased. (translated).

cells.content: 十六。至關中，誅秦王子嬰，屠燒咸陽。分天下，立諸侯。
cells.literal: Sixteen. Arrived Guan Zhong, executed Qin prince Ziying, massacred burned Xianyang. Divided the world, established feudal lords.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. Arrived Guan Zhong, executed Qin prince Ziying, massacred burned Xianyang. Divided the world, established feudal lords. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-five. Divided Zhao into Dai state.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-five. Divided Zhao into Dai state. (translated).

cells.content: 十八。項羽怨榮，分齊為三國。
cells.literal: Eighteen. Xiang Yu resented Rong, divided Qi into three states.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Xiang Yu resented Rong, divided Qi into three states. (translated).

cells.content: 二十九。與項羽有纳，見之戲下，講解。羽倍約，分關中為四國。
cells.literal: Twenty-nine. Had grievance with Xiang Yu, met him below Xi, made peace. Yu broke agreement, divided Guanzhong into four states.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-nine. Had grievance with Xiang Yu, met him below Xi, made peace. Yu broke agreement, divided Guanzhong into four states. (translated).

cells.content: 二十九。臧荼從入，分燕為二國。
cells.literal: Twenty-nine. Zang Tu followed entered, divided Yan into two states.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-nine. Zang Tu followed entered, divided Yan into two states. (translated).

cells.literal: Seventeen. Divided Wei into Yin state.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. Divided Wei into Yin state. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty. Divided Han into Henan state.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. Divided Han into Henan state. (translated).

cells.content: 九。義帝元年。諸侯尊懷王為義帝。
cells.literal: Nine. Righteous Emperor first year. Feudal lords honored Huai Wang as Righteous Emperor.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Righteous Emperor first year. Feudal lords honored Huai Wang as Righteous Emperor. (translated).

cells.content: 十七。項籍自立為西楚霸王。
cells.literal: Seventeen. Xiang Ji self-established as Western Chu Hegemon King.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. Xiang Ji self-established as Western Chu Hegemon King. (translated).

cells.literal: First month. Divided Guanzhong into Han.
cells.idiomatic: First month. Divided Guanzhong into Han. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Moved capital to southern Jiangnan Chen.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Moved capital to southern Jiangnan Chen. (translated).

cells.content: 西楚主伯，項籍始，為天下主命，主十八王。
cells.literal: Western Chu hegemon uncle, Xiang Ji beginning, for world main fate, main eighteen kings.
cells.idiomatic: Western Chu hegemon uncle, Xiang Ji beginning, for world main fate, main eighteen kings. (translated).

cells.literal: King Wu Rui beginning, former Fan lord.
cells.idiomatic: King Wu Rui beginning, former Fan lord. (translated).

cells.literal: King Gong Ao beginning, former Chu pillar state.
cells.idiomatic: King Gong Ao beginning, former Chu pillar state. (translated).

cells.literal: King Ying Bu beginning, former Chu general.
cells.idiomatic: King Ying Bu beginning, former Chu general. (translated).

cells.literal: King Zhang Er beginning, former Chu general.
cells.idiomatic: King Zhang Er beginning, former Chu general. (translated).

cells.content: 二十七。。王趙歇始，故趙王。
cells.literal: Twenty-seven. King Zhao Xie beginning, former Zhao king.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-seven. King Zhao Xie beginning, former Zhao king. (translated).

cells.literal: King Tian Du beginning, former Qi general.
cells.idiomatic: King Tian Du beginning, former Qi general. (translated).

cells.literal: King Tian An beginning, former Qi general.
cells.idiomatic: King Tian An beginning, former Qi general. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty. King Tian Shi beginning, former Qi king.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. King Tian Shi beginning, former Qi king. (translated).

cells.literal: Second month. Han king beginning, former Pei Gong.
cells.idiomatic: Second month. Han king beginning, former Pei Gong. (translated).

cells.literal: King Zhang Han beginning, former Qin general.
cells.idiomatic: King Zhang Han beginning, former Qin general. (translated).

cells.literal: King Sima Xin beginning, former Qin general.
cells.idiomatic: King Sima Xin beginning, former Qin general. (translated).

cells.literal: King Dong Yi beginning, former Qin general.
cells.idiomatic: King Dong Yi beginning, former Qin general. (translated).

cells.literal: King Zang Tu beginning, former Yan general.
cells.idiomatic: King Zang Tu beginning, former Yan general. (translated).

cells.content: 三十一。王韓廣始，故燕王。
cells.literal: Thirty-one. King Han Guang beginning, former Yan king.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-one. King Han Guang beginning, former Yan king. (translated).

cells.literal: Nineteen. King Wei Bao beginning, former Wei king.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. King Wei Bao beginning, former Wei king. (translated).

cells.literal: King Sima Ang beginning, former Zhao general.
cells.idiomatic: King Sima Ang beginning, former Zhao general. (translated).

cells.content: 二十二。王韓成始，故韓將。
cells.literal: Twenty-two. King Han Cheng beginning, former Han general.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-two. King Han Cheng beginning, former Han general. (translated).

cells.literal: King Shen Yang beginning, former Chu general.
cells.idiomatic: King Shen Yang beginning, former Chu general. (translated).

cells.content: 三。諸侯罷戲下兵，皆之國。
cells.literal: Three. Feudal lords dismissed Xi troops, all went to their states.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Feudal lords dismissed Xi troops, all went to their states. (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Tian Rong attacked Du, Du surrendered to Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Tian Rong attacked Du, Du surrendered to Chu. (translated).

cells.literal: Qi king Tian Rong beginning, former Qi chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Qi king Tian Rong beginning, former Qi chancellor. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-four. Tian Rong attacked killed Shi.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Tian Rong attacked killed Shi. (translated).

cells.literal: Six. Tian Rong attacked killed An.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Tian Rong attacked killed An. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Han defended Feiqiu, Han surrounded him.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Han defended Feiqiu, Han surrounded him. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Xin surrendered to Han, state eliminated.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Xin surrendered to Han, state eliminated. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Yi surrendered to Han, state eliminated.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Yi surrendered to Han, state eliminated. (translated).

cells.content: 三十七。臧荼擊廣無終，滅之。
cells.literal: Thirty-seven. Zang Tu attacked Guang Wuzhong, extinguished it.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-seven. Zang Tu attacked Guang Wuzhong, extinguished it. (translated).

cells.literal: Han king Zheng Chang beginning, Xiang Yu established him.
cells.idiomatic: Han king Zheng Chang beginning, Xiang Yu established him. (translated).

cells.literal: Belonged to Han, became Weinan, Heshang commanderies.
cells.idiomatic: Belonged to Han, became Weinan, Heshang commanderies. (translated).

cells.literal: Belonged to Han as Shang commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Belonged to Han as Shang commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Xiang Yu extinguished Righteous Emperor.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Xiang Yu extinguished Righteous Emperor. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-five. Xie again became king of Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-five. Xie again became king of Zhao. (translated).

cells.literal: Tenth month. King arrived at Shan.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth month. King arrived at Shan. (translated).

cells.literal: Han king Xin beginning, Han established him.
cells.idiomatic: Han king Xin beginning, Han established him. (translated).

cells.literal: Belonged to Han, became Henan commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Belonged to Han, became Henan commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 歇以陳餘為代王，故成安君。
cells.literal: Xie made Chen Yu Dai king, former Cheng'an lord.
cells.idiomatic: Xie made Chen Yu Dai king, former Cheng'an lord. (translated).

cells.content: 八。項籍擊榮，走平原平原民殺之。
cells.literal: Eight. Xiang Ji attacked Rong, fled Pingyuan Pingyuan people killed him.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Xiang Ji attacked Rong, fled Pingyuan Pingyuan people killed him. (translated).

cells.content: 項籍立故齊王田假為齊王。
cells.literal: Xiang Ji established former Qi king Tian Jia as Qi king.
cells.idiomatic: Xiang Ji established former Qi king Tian Jia as Qi king. (translated).

cells.content: 二。田榮弟橫反城陽，擊假，走楚，楚殺假。
cells.literal: Two. Tian Rong younger brother Heng rebelled Chengyang, attacked Jia, fled Chu, Chu killed Jia.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Tian Rong younger brother Heng rebelled Chengyang, attacked Jia, fled Chu, Chu killed Jia. (translated).

cells.literal: Fourteen. Surrendered to Han, Ang deposed.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. Surrendered to Han, Ang deposed. (translated).

cells.content: 三。項羽以兵三萬破漢兵五十六萬。
cells.literal: Three. Xiang Yu with troops thirty thousand broke Han troops fifty-six thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Xiang Yu with troops thirty thousand broke Han troops fifty-six thousand. (translated).

cells.content: 齊王田廣始。廣，榮子，橫立之。
cells.literal: Qi king Tian Guang beginning. Guang, Rong son, Heng established him.
cells.idiomatic: Qi king Tian Guang beginning. Guang, Rong son, Heng established him. (translated).

cells.content: 四月。王伐楚至彭城，壞走。
cells.literal: Fourth month. King attacked Chu reached Pengcheng, defeated fled.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month. King attacked Chu reached Pengcheng, defeated fled. (translated).

cells.literal: Became Hedong commandery, belonged to Han.
cells.idiomatic: Became Hedong commandery, belonged to Han. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-four. Bao returned, rebelled against Han.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-four. Bao returned, rebelled against Han. (translated).

cells.content: 六月。王入關，立太子。復如滎陽。
cells.literal: Sixth month. King entered Guan, established crown prince. Again went to Xiangyang.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth month. King entered Guan, established crown prince. Again went to Xiangyang. (translated).

cells.literal: Five. Han killed Han at Feiqiu.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Han killed Han at Feiqiu. (translated).

cells.content: 屬漢，為隴西、北地、中地郡。
cells.literal: Belonged to Han, became Longxi, Beidi, Zhongdi commanderies.
cells.idiomatic: Belonged to Han, became Longxi, Beidi, Zhongdi commanderies. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-eight. Han general Xin captured Bao.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-eight. Han general Xin captured Bao. (translated).

cells.literal: Belonged to Han, became Hedong, Shangdang commanderies.
cells.idiomatic: Belonged to Han, became Hedong, Shangdang commanderies. (translated).

cells.literal: Twelve. Han general Han Xin executed Chen Yu.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Han general Han Xin executed Chen Yu. (translated).

cells.literal: Belonged to Han, became Taiyuan commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Belonged to Han, became Taiyuan commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 十二。布身降漢，地屬項籍。
cells.literal: Twelve. Bu personally surrendered to Han, lands belonged to Xiang Ji.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Bu personally surrendered to Han, lands belonged to Xiang Ji. (translated).

cells.literal: Fourth month. Chu surrounded king at Xiangyang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month. Chu surrounded king at Xiangyang. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty one. King Ao passed away.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty one. King Ao passed away. (translated).

cells.literal: Seventh month. The king left Xingyang.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh month. The king left Xingyang. (translated).

cells.literal: Linjiang King Huan. Beginning, son of the first wife.
cells.idiomatic: Linjiang King Huan. Beginning, son of the first wife. (translated).

cells.literal: Eighth month. Zhou Ke, Song Gong killed Wei Bao.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth month. Zhou Ke, Song Gong killed Wei Bao. (translated).

cells.content: 十一。漢將韓信破殺龍且。
cells.literal: Eleventh. Han general Han Xin defeated and killed Long Ju.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh. Han general Han Xin defeated and killed Long Ju. (translated).

cells.literal: Zhao king Zhang Er beginning, Han established him.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao king Zhang Er beginning, Han established him. (translated).

cells.content: 二十一。漢將韓信擊殺廣。
cells.literal: Twenty first. Han general Han Xin attacked and killed Guang.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty first. Han general Han Xin attacked and killed Guang. (translated).

cells.literal: Belonged to Han, became a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Belonged to Han, became a commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Qi king Han Xin beginning, Han established him.
cells.idiomatic: Qi king Han Xin beginning, Han established him. (translated).

cells.literal: Second month. Established Xin as king of Qi.
cells.idiomatic: Second month. Established Xin as king of Qi. (translated).

cells.literal: Third. Han imperial secretary Zhou Ke entered Chu, died.
cells.idiomatic: Third. Han imperial secretary Zhou Ke entered Chu, died. (translated).

cells.literal: Third month. Zhou Ke entered Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Third month. Zhou Ke entered Chu. (translated).

cells.literal: Fourth month. The king left Xingyang. Bao died.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month. The king left Xingyang. Bao died. (translated).

cells.literal: Huainan king Ying Bu beginning, Han established him.
cells.idiomatic: Huainan king Ying Bu beginning, Han established him. (translated).

cells.literal: Seventh month. Established Bu as Huainan king.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh month. Established Bu as Huainan king. (translated).

cells.literal: Ninth month. Taigong, Empress Lü returned from Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth month. Taigong, Empress Lü returned from Chu. (translated).

cells.literal: Qi king Han Xin moved to Chu king.
cells.idiomatic: Qi king Han Xin moved to Chu king. (translated).

cells.literal: Belonged to Han, became Nanguo commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Belonged to Han, became Nanguo commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 十二。徙王楚，屬漢，為四郡。
cells.literal: Twelfth. Moved king to Chu, belonged to Han, became four commanderies.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth. Moved king to Chu, belonged to Han, became four commanderies. (translated).

cells.content: 正月。。殺項籍，天下平，諸侯臣屬漢。
cells.literal: First month.. killed Xiang Ji, world pacified, feudal lords became subjects of Han.
cells.idiomatic: First month.. killed Xiang Ji, world pacified, feudal lords became subjects of Han. (translated).

cells.literal: Fifth year first month. Yan state
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year first month. Yan state (translated).

cells.content: 四。韓王信徙王代，都馬邑。
cells.literal: Fourth. Han king Xin moved to king Dai, capital Mayi.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth. Han king Xin moved to king Dai, capital Mayi. (translated).

cells.literal: Divided Linjiang to become Changsha state.
cells.idiomatic: Divided Linjiang to become Changsha state. (translated).

cells.content: 二月。甲午，王更號，即皇帝位於定陶。
cells.literal: Second month. Jiawu day, the king changed his title, assumed the emperor position at Dingtao.
cells.idiomatic: Second month. Jiawu day, the king changed his title, assumed the emperor position at Dingtao. (translated).

cells.content: 衡山王吳芮為為長沙王。
cells.literal: Hengshan king Wu Rui became Changsha king.
cells.idiomatic: Hengshan king Wu Rui became Changsha king. (translated).

cells.literal: Sixth month. The emperor entered the pass.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth month. The emperor entered the pass. (translated).

cells.literal: Ninth. Er passed away, posthumous title King Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth. Er passed away, posthumous title King Jing. (translated).

cells.literal: Sixth. Passed away, posthumous title King Wen.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth. Passed away, posthumous title King Wen. (translated).

cells.literal: Zhao king Zhang Ao beginning, Er's son.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao king Zhang Ao beginning, Er's son. (translated).

cells.literal: Eighth month. The emperor personally led troops to execute Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth month. The emperor personally led troops to execute Yan. (translated).

cells.literal: Changsha King Cheng Chen beginning, Rui's son.
cells.idiomatic: Changsha King Cheng Chen beginning, Rui's son. (translated).

cells.content: 九。王得故項羽將鍾離辚，斬之以聞。
cells.literal: Ninth. The king captured former Xiang Yu general Zhongli Mo, executed him to report.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth. The king captured former Xiang Yu general Zhongli Mo, executed him to report. (translated).

cells.literal: Ninth. Rebelled against Han, captured Tu.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth. Rebelled against Han, captured Tu. (translated).

cells.literal: Yan king Lu Wan beginning, Han grand marshal.
cells.idiomatic: Yan king Lu Wan beginning, Han grand marshal. (translated).
